Class Pig

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pig

  • public class Pig
extends java.lang.Object
    A variation on the very popular Game of Pig. See Wikipedia: Pig (dice game) for detailed game play rules. This interactive game is written by CSC110 programmers with the following game rules: The player and computer each take turns rolling a die a number of times. If the die rolls one, the turn is over and no points are scored for that turn. If the die rolls any other number, the value is added to the current turn score. Each turn lasts until the player passes on a roll. In this game, the computer will pass after 4 turns.

      • diceRoll

        public static int diceRoll(java.util.Random rand)
        Rolls a single die.
        Parameters:
        rand - The random generator that determines the roll.
        Returns:
        A single value between 1 and 6.

      • playerTurn

        public static int playerTurn(java.util.Scanner input,
                             java.util.Random rand)
        The player's turn. The player turn starts with a roll of a die. The player is then repeatedly prompted for another roll. Use the String method equalsIgnoreCase to ignore capitalization when checking if the player's response is a yes or no (so "Yes" and "yes" are treated the same). The turn ends in one of two cases:
        1. When the player says "no" to another roll, the accumulated total is then returned.
        2. When the die roll is 1, then the accumulated total is reduced to zero.
        Each roll of the die is communicated by a printed statement. When the turn ends, a message is printed that indicates the accummulated score for this turn.
        Parameters:
        input - The Scanner object that is communicating with the user (who is the player) through the console.
        rand - The random number generator used in the game.
        Returns:
        The total turn score for the player.

      • computerTurn

        public static int computerTurn(java.util.Random rand)
        The computer's turn. By default, the computer will have 4 rolls of the die, accumulating in a turn score, unless the die rolls 1, in which case the turn score will be zero. Each roll of the die is communicated by a printed statement. When the turn ends, a message is printed that indicates the accummulated score for this turn.
        Parameters:
        rand - The random number generator used in the game.
        Returns:
        The total turn score for the computer.

      • gameLoop

        public static void gameLoop()
        This method controls the flow of the game. It organizes each round, playerTurn then computerTurn, until one or both attain a total score of 100. If the player has the higher score over 100, then the method prints out that the player is the winner and the game ends. If the computer is the winner, then the message will announce the computer to be the winner and the game ends.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This main method is specifically used to test each of the methods carefully and incrementally, before testing the final gamePlay method.
        Parameters:
        args - Is not used in this particular method.
